page.title: 15SHERRARDS CENTRE
page.content: Sherrards is a training centre for handicapped young people. It provides vocational assessment and training using electrical and mechanical assembly, packing, light engineering and wood-working as a basis for work experience. The centre also provides social and independence training as an integral part of the course. Sherrards was opened by the Spastics Society in 1958 to cater for people with cerebral palsy. Today, people with other handicaps are also considered for training. The centre stands in its own grounds in Welwyn Garden City. The aim of the centre is to try to help young handicapped people to prepare themselves for employment and to try to help them find jobs. It also encourages the trainees to become as independent as possible in their daily lives.
